review_text:
Simply fantastic! ü§©üêüü¶Ä
It‚Äôs worth visiting Aveiro just for this restaurant. We took a day trip from Porto and decided to eat here spontaneously. Even without a reservation, we got a table for an hour and a half. The stuffed sapateira and the grilled sea bass were simply incredible, and the rice that came with the fish was excellent too, full of mussels and shrimp, perfectly cooked and bursting with flavour.

The service was also extremely friendly, fun, and welcoming, which made the experience even more special. They showed us the fresh catch of the day and asked us our preferences. And to top it off, the price is unbeatable for the quality of the food and service. A truly great experience!

review_text:
A ten-star restaurant!
The food was spectacular. We ordered the Veggie Gua Bao, Pad Thai, and Tahu Goreng Kacang. All the dishes were delicious, but the rice was on another level. We then chose two desserts, Chuoi Chung and Kue Lapis Legit, both very different, which made them even more special.
The decor is tastefully done.
The service was impeccable. Everyone was more friendly and professional than the last.
The bathroom was very clean, which speaks volumes about the restaurant itself.
Perfect, we'll be back!

review_text:
Housed in a building dating back to 1915, this museum is a participatory space dedicated to preserving and sharing the urban memory of Aveiro. Exhibitions are curated around the experiences and records of local residents, creating a deeply personal and community-focused narrative. Though modest in size, the museum offers thoughtfully curated content with meaningful depth. Above all, the staff are known for their exceptional friendliness and hospitality, enhancing the visitor experience.
‚Äª Included in Aveiro Museum Pass.

review_text:
This is the go-to place for trying the traditional Aveiro pastries made with "ovos moles".

They have a great variety of products. All made in-house and super fresh.

And, although they look the same, each has its own texture and flavor, which makes it worth trying them all.

You can notice the difference in quality when compared with pre-packed products available in other stores.

And they've been doing this for 56 years now.

review_text:
Last night marked my second visit to this remarkable restaurant in Aveiro, and it was just as exceptional as the first. As a vegetarian, finding restaurants that cater thoughtfully to plant-based diets can be a challenge, but this place not only meets expectations‚Äîit exceeds them.
From the first bite to the last, every dish was a celebration of flavor and creativity. The chef, Ricardo, takes immense pride in his craft, and it shows in every detail. The ingredients are locally sourced, offering a unique taste of the region that you won‚Äôt find elsewhere. Each plate is a testament to his dedication to quality and authenticity.
What truly sets this restaurant apart is the warmth and hospitality. Ricardo treats every guest like family, making you feel as though you‚Äôre dining in his own home. His passion for Portuguese cuisine shines through in every interaction and every dish.
If you‚Äôre in Aveiro, this restaurant is an absolute must-visit‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre a vegetarian or a carnivore. It‚Äôs a culinary experience that beautifully blends tradition, innovation, and heart. I can‚Äôt wait to return!

review_text: A place to park near a spectacular beach and town. The area itself is quite basic. You have to pay to collect water, but not to empty either gray or black sewage. There's a parking lot next door where you can also spend the night, but you can't expand your space with tables, chairs, and the like. So, for 5 euros, we preferred to set up the whole Nativity scene and be safe from fines (signs already warn against overnight parking, although you'll later see they don't strictly enforce this). The location of the area is unbeatable. Spectacular beach. There are free cold showers and restrooms at a beach bar opposite the RV area, which you can use.

review_text:
Absolutely beautiful seafood restaraunt right off the water of Aviero / Costa Nova.

The owner seated us and was very friendly. They helped us pick out some nice wines to pair with the meal and we got some of the best seafood I‚Äôve had in my life. The octopus was cooked perfectly and not the least bit rubbery, it was almost soft and pillowy in your mouth. The prawn was gushing with flavors and was so fresh. The clams had the simplest sauce to simply intensify the natural amazing flavor. And of course, we tried all of the deserts, and they were all to die for. Also, I believe the Sous Chef served our food and was able to answer some questions we had about the meal.

This was one of those truly rare 11/10 dining experiences. The service, ambiance, and food were all literally perfect. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

I'm sorry that nowadays the service is not able to apologize.
After asking what is the soup of a day i received the answer that it is vegetable soup. I ordered it.

Immediately after it was placed on the table I smelled meat. Afer asking if it comes with meat the answer was, yes it does, with sausage. I said that unfortunately I don't eat meat and I won't eat the soup.

Of course I had to pay for it in the end without any apology. I understand that I should have checked before ordering whether the vegetable soup by any chance contains meat ... Local accommodation apartments with a wonderful location. They have the lake in front and the ocean behind them.

review_text: We stayed for a week in July 2024. A fantastic apartment in a perfect location. With a terrace, views of the estuary, and very well-equipped. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the beach (a large inlet), surrounded by good restaurants, and easy parking (at least in July). Paulo gave us some great recommendations for places to visit, bars, and restaurants. It's wonderful to walk along the beach or its walkways. It's also not usually that stifling heat we've been suffering from in the Iberian Peninsula these past summers. It's 15 minutes from Aveiro. I also recommend visiting the chapel, museum, and shop at Vista Alegre. A place to come back again. However, I recommend always staying on Costa Nova beach. We found Barra beach to be overcrowded.

review_text: Amazing stay in an amazing locale. The hotel looks unassuming from the outside, but it's modern and gorgeous inside! I booked a superior room and I'm glad I did - I could have spent the whole trip out on that beautiful balcony overlooking the lighthouse and the beach. Breathtaking! I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the area

review_text:
I am making the review covering it by parts: 1. Accessibility, place, the local area.
1.Acessibilty- Easy access by car through highways "A25" and "EN's" (nationals), no fuss, parking wise you can find lots of public spaces on roads nearby.
2. Cozy room(3rd floor), safe locker, mini bar, lots of space, we requested a baby bed and the space was suitable for it. Bed  mattress queen size, WC with bathtub, hairdryer, and make up mirror.
3. We went in January to this place, so low season regarding occupancy and we notice that at night some restaurants and bars were open and with some medium attendance so expect high season to be quite crowdy.
Extra note: the view to the lighthouse and seaside was amazing.

review_text:
Absolutely beautiful seafood restaraunt right off the water of Aviero / Costa Nova.

The owner seated us and was very friendly. They helped us pick out some nice wines to pair with the meal and we got some of the best seafood I‚Äôve had in my life. The octopus was cooked perfectly and not the least bit rubbery, it was almost soft and pillowy in your mouth. The prawn was gushing with flavors and was so fresh. The clams had the simplest sauce to simply intensify the natural amazing flavor. And of course, we tried all of the deserts, and they were all to die for. Also, I believe the Sous Chef served our food and was able to answer some questions we had about the meal.

This was one of those truly rare 11/10 dining experiences. The service, ambiance, and food were all literally perfect. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

review_text: We stayed for a week in July 2024. A fantastic apartment in a perfect location. With a terrace, views of the estuary, and very well-equipped. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the beach (a large inlet), surrounded by good restaurants, and easy parking (at least in July). Paulo gave us some great recommendations for places to visit, bars, and restaurants. It's wonderful to walk along the beach or its walkways. It's also not usually that stifling heat we've been suffering from in the Iberian Peninsula these past summers. It's 15 minutes from Aveiro. I also recommend visiting the chapel, museum, and shop at Vista Alegre. A place to come back again. However, I recommend always staying on Costa Nova beach. We found Barra beach to be overcrowded.

review_text:
Absolutely beautiful seafood restaraunt right off the water of Aviero / Costa Nova.

The owner seated us and was very friendly. They helped us pick out some nice wines to pair with the meal and we got some of the best seafood I‚Äôve had in my life. The octopus was cooked perfectly and not the least bit rubbery, it was almost soft and pillowy in your mouth. The prawn was gushing with flavors and was so fresh. The clams had the simplest sauce to simply intensify the natural amazing flavor. And of course, we tried all of the deserts, and they were all to die for. Also, I believe the Sous Chef served our food and was able to answer some questions we had about the meal.

This was one of those truly rare 11/10 dining experiences. The service, ambiance, and food were all literally perfect. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

review_text: We stayed for a week in July 2024. A fantastic apartment in a perfect location. With a terrace, views of the estuary, and very well-equipped. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the beach (a large inlet), surrounded by good restaurants, and easy parking (at least in July). Paulo gave us some great recommendations for places to visit, bars, and restaurants. It's wonderful to walk along the beach or its walkways. It's also not usually that stifling heat we've been suffering from in the Iberian Peninsula these past summers. It's 15 minutes from Aveiro. I also recommend visiting the chapel, museum, and shop at Vista Alegre. A place to come back again. However, I recommend always staying on Costa Nova beach. We found Barra beach to be overcrowded.

review_text: I do not recommend this restaurant to anybody. The service was atrocious. The restaurant is supposed to open at 12 pm but it only actually opened closer to 12:15 pm. We were a table of 4 people and we sat down in the terrace at the same time as the people at four other tables. After waiting for nearly 10 minutes, I had to wave the waitress over to tell her we were ready to order as she had essentially ignored us up until then. She was unpleasant and looked very disinterested by us. She had already gone to all the other tables to take their orders. By the time we ordered, one of the other tables had already received their food and drinks. Incredibly, after repeating our order to us to ensure she didn‚Äôt miss anything, she forgot to place an order for the plate of sardines ordered by my mother. Of course, she only realized this 45 minutes later. Meanwhile, the dish for my wife and I, which had a 30 minute preparation time, arrived after almost 45 minutes. The other tables on the terrace had already finished their lunch and paid their bills. I told the waitress that the service was a disgrace but she could not have cared less. The staff did not even try to smooth things over by offering a discount or a free item in the house. I‚Äôve grown accustomed to average service at bars and restaurants but the service we experienced here was unacceptable.

review_text: A beautiful small hotel (villa with 3 floors and several rooms) located on the "beach promondory" of the Costa Nova" near Aveiro. You need to choose a room (at a higher price) with a sea view (this means an inner bay, not the open ocean) - these rooms are larger with a big balcony and the view is much nicer than the opposite rooms facing the street.  The rooms facing to the street are also very small. The ocean view also allows you to see flocks of flamingos with binoculars or a cell phone etc. The surroundings are very nice, cute typical Portuguese colorful striped houses, long promenade along them and along the sea. Right next to the hoel is an excellent fish restaurant, fruit/vegetable shop and market with fish, other goodies, cheese, wine, olives pastries and of course a fish restaurant upstairs, pharmacy and big parking place. The beach - open ocean - is a few minutes walk away. The beaches are gorgeous - long stretches of wild, sandy, but manicured beaches, with restaurants where you can watch amazing sunsets while having a carafe of sangria. By car it's a few minutes to the centre of Aveiro and the university, but there is a bus service too. Breakfast is possible in the detached building of the hotel, where there is also a reception with 24 h-service (about 50 m from the hotel villa). The cleaning is precise. Overall, I definitely recommend the hotel - we spent a little over a week here as part of a business trip (scientific conference at the university) and a shorter holiday.

review_text:
This cafe is right on the water with sitting inside and outside. Someone suggested I try their Pastel da Nata. And I can tell you that it was indeed one of the best I have ever had.
The pastry was nice and crisp, almost like a very good croissant, very flaky. The custard was just right with almost perfect sweetness.
If you are traveling on Portugal coast and happen to be around Aveiro area, you must visit this small cafe.
I also asked for cafe com leite to be extra hot and it was indeed that. Most places it is like warm, so if you ask for they will make it.
The breeze is nice and cool and the cafe is awesome. Overall 5 star.
The total cost Coffee/latte and two pastries, ‚Ç¨3.90.....Coffee in my hometown in Seattle cost almost $6

review_text:
Absolutely beautiful seafood restaraunt right off the water of Aviero / Costa Nova.

The owner seated us and was very friendly. They helped us pick out some nice wines to pair with the meal and we got some of the best seafood I‚Äôve had in my life. The octopus was cooked perfectly and not the least bit rubbery, it was almost soft and pillowy in your mouth. The prawn was gushing with flavors and was so fresh. The clams had the simplest sauce to simply intensify the natural amazing flavor. And of course, we tried all of the deserts, and they were all to die for. Also, I believe the Sous Chef served our food and was able to answer some questions we had about the meal.

This was one of those truly rare 11/10 dining experiences. The service, ambiance, and food were all literally perfect. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

review_text:
I'm sorry that nowadays the service is not able to apologize.
After asking what is the soup of a day i received the answer that it is vegetable soup. I ordered it.

Immediately after it was placed on the table I smelled meat. Afer asking if it comes with meat the answer was, yes it does, with sausage. I said that unfortunately I don't eat meat and I won't eat the soup.

Of course I had to pay for it in the end without any apology. I understand that I should have checked before ordering whether the vegetable soup by any chance contains meat ... I don't understand that the situation was not resolved in any way and that I didn't even deserve an apology for not being offered any other option or any: "we are sorry for uncomplete information" "we are sorry that we didnt try to understand client's side"....whatever would be accepted and would made one feel kinda let's say heard or seen.

For me a no go
